quote: If moral behavior were simply following rules, we could program a computer to be moral.
author: Samuel P. Ginder

quote: If we wish to free ourselves from enslavement, we must choose freedom and the responsibility this entails.
author: Leo F. Buscaglia

quote: Love is life ... And if you miss love, you miss life.
author: Leo F. Buscaglia

quote: We have a call to do good, as often as we have the power and occasion.
author: William Penn

quote: If thou wouldst conquer thy weakness thou must not gratify it.
author: William Penn

quote: He who passively accepts evil is as much involved in it as he who helps perpetrate it.
author: Martin Luther King

quote: Heaven will be inherited by every man who has heaven in his soul.
author: Henry Ward Beecher

quote: The future is not something we enter. The future is something we create.
author: Leonard I. Sweet

quote: Visionary is a self-fulfilling prophet. Don't predict the future. Create it.
author: Leland Kaiser

quote: There is zero, and there is eternity, and there is mortality, but there is no ultimate.
author: Stephen King

quote: An error doesn't become a mistake until you refuse to correct it.
author: Orlando A. Battista

quote: One sees great things from the valley, only small things from the peak.
author: Gilbert Keith Chesterton

quote: Sixty minutes of thinking of any kind is bound to lead to confusion and unhappiness.
author: James Thurber

quote: The civilized man is a more experienced and wiser savage.
author: Henry David Thoreau

quote: The law must be stable, but it must not stand still.
author: Roscoe Pound

quote: It is the greatest art of the devil to convince us he does not exist.
author: Pierre Charles Baudelaire

quote: Sentimentality is a superstructure covering brutality.
author: Carl Gustav Jung

quote: I know there are no errors, In the great Eternal plan.
author: Ella Wheeler Wilcox

quote: You cannot escape the responsibility of tomorrow by evading it today.
author: Abraham Lincoln

quote: Problems cannot be solved at the same level of awareness that created them.
author: Albert Einstein

quote: If moral behavior were simply following rules, we could program a computer to be moral.
author: Samuel P. Ginder

quote: A professor is one who talks in someone else's sleep.
author: Wystan Hugh Auden

quote: Men achieve a certain greatness unawares, when working to another aim.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: We love music for the buried hopes, the garnered memories, the tender feelings it can summon at a touch.
author: Samuel Rogers

quote: There is not a more pleasing exercise of the mind than gratitude.
author: Joseph Addison

quote: What is read twice is commonly better remembered than what is transcribed.
author: Samuel Johnson

quote: When men yield up the privilege of thinking, the last shadow of liberty quits the horizon.
author: Thomas Paine

quote: There is no meaning to life except the meaning man gives to his life by the unfolding of his powers.
author: Erich Fromm

quote: OPPORTUNITY, n. A favorable occasion for grasping a disappointment.
author: Ambrose Gwinett Bierce

quote: When you stop learning, stop listening, stop looking and asking questions, always new questions, then it is time to die.
author: Lillian Smith

quote: Some people change their ways when they see the light; others when they feel the heat.
author: Caroline Schroeder

quote: Try not to do too many things at once. Know what you want, the number one thing today and tomorrow. Persevere and get it done.
author: Gracie Allen

quote: It is always wise to stop wishing for things long enough to enjoy the fragrance of those now flowering.
author: Patricia Clafford

quote: The capacity of human beings to bore one another seems to be vastly greater than that of any other animal.
author: H. L. Mencken

quote: There is one thing which gives radiance to everything. It is the idea of something around the corner.
author: Gilbert Keith Chesterton

quote: Never worry about theory as long as the machinery does what it's supposed to do.
author: Robert Anson Heinlein

quote: For this is the true strength of guilty kings, When they corrupt the souls of those they rule.
author: Matthew Arnold

quote: A late facetious writer, who told the public that whenever he was dull they might be assured there was a design in it.
author: Henry Fielding

quote: Freedom always carries a burden of proof, always throws us back on ourselves.
author: Shelby Steele

quote: My success just evolved from working hard at the business at hand each day.
author: Johnny Carson
